page.title: 03SWINDEN RESERVOIR
page.content:
RESERVOIRS
{SWINDEN NO.1 RESERVOIR. This reservoir was built in 1864 and covers 18 acres. Its main feeder stream is Swinden Water which comes down a deep valley from the very heart of Extwistle Moor.The reservoir, which contains 116 million gallons, provides drinking water for the Burnley area and is checked daily by the Water Authority in order to record the depth of water, to adjust the flow leaving the reservoir, and to check the safety of the embankment.Visitors are not encouraged and no other use is made of the reservoir.
